snippet: Gaza’s lone power plant sputtered back to life for the first time in seven weeks after Qatar paid for fuel shipped from Israel.
lead_paragraph: Gaza’s lone power plant sputtered back to life for the first time in seven weeks after Qatar paid for fuel shipped from Israel.
abstract: Gaza's lone power plant sputters back to life after $10 million grant from Qatar covering cost of diesel fuel from Israel; move brings relief to area, where a lack of cheap fuel has contributed to the overflow of raw sewage, 21-hour blackouts and flooding, and ends finger-pointing between Palestinian Authority and Hamas.

headline.main: Gaza, Vexed by Floods, Gets Fuel and Power
headline.print_headline: Gaza, Vexed By Floods, Gets Fuel And Power

byline.contributor: Fares Akram reported from Gaza, and Isabel Kershner from Jerusalem. Hwaida Saad contributed reporting from Beirut, Lebanon.
byline.original: By FARES AKRAM and ISABEL KERSHNER
